channel.title: Pancake on Cooking
channel.description: Recent content in Pancake on Cooking

item.title: Banana Pancakes
item.description: ‚è≤Ô∏è Prep time: 10 minutes üç≥ Cook time: 10 minutes üçΩÔ∏è Servings: 4 people Ingredients 1 cup flour (2.5 dl) 1 tablespoon sugar 2 teaspoon baking powder 1 cup milk (2.5 dl) 1 egg 2 very ripe bananas Directions Combine flour, sugar, baking powder and a little bit of salt in a large mixing bowl. Whisk milk and egg into the flour mixture until no clumps remain in the resulting batter.

item.title: Danish Pancake
item.description: Danish Pancake recipe Ingredients 375g wheat flour a little bit of salt (1/3 of a teaspoon) 1 ¬Ω tablespoon sugar 9 dl milk 4 Eggs Directions Put all the ingredients in a bowl and stir until it’s all mixed up. Preheat a pan with butter or Margarine. Turn when one side starts turning brown. They are done when both sides start turning brown. Add Butter or Margarine when needed.

item.title: Oaty Pancakes
item.description: ‚è≤Ô∏è Prep time: 10 min üç≥ Cook time: 10 min üçΩÔ∏è Servings: 4 Ingredients 3‚ÅÑ4 cup milk 3‚ÅÑ4 rolled oats 1 egg 1‚ÅÑ2 teaspoon salt 2-3 tablespoon sugar 1‚ÅÑ2 cup flour 2 teaspoon baking powder 2 teaspoon baking soda 25g butter (melted) Directions Pour milk over rolled oats. Add remaining ingredients. Mix with fork (or in a food processor) just enough to combine ingredients. Put spoonfuls of mixture onto preheated, greased or sprayed griddle or fry pan.

item.title: Pancake
item.description: Here is a simple Pancake recipe Ingredients 200g wheat flour 200 ml milk 2 Eggs 2 teaspoon sugar 1 teaspoon baking soda a little bit of salt Directions combine all ingredients all in a bowl and stir preheat a pan and add some oil Pour or scoop the batter onto the pan Brown on both sides Contribution BeFe
